meanings.definition: A member of a gang that ambushes and robs people in forests and mountains.
meanings.sent1: The brigands emerged from the shadows, ready to steal from unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent2: The villagers lived in fear of the brigands who lurked in the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The brigands tried to rob a wizard, but he turned them all into frogs instead!
meanings.sent4: The idea of time can be like brigands, stealing moments when we least expect it.
meanings.sent5: The image of the brigands' masks haunted the dreams of the townspeople.

meanings.definition: A group of bandits or outlaws.
meanings.sent1: The king's army set out to capture the brigands hiding in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The sheriff finally caught the brigands who had been terrorizing the town for months.
meanings.sent3: The brigands decided to have a picnic in the middle of their heist.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered like a gathering of brigands, ready to unleash chaos.
meanings.sent5: The smell of danger lingered in the air, a sign that the brigands were near.
